image.altText: The arm of an unidentified child playing with toys

props.synopsis: Joshua Dale Brown was sacked from a Melbourne childcare centre months before joining another centre where he is accused of committing child sex offences.

title.children: Accused child sex offender Joshua Dale Brown sacked from former childcare employer

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles wearing a red "Make America great again" hat

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump brands supporters "weaklings" and "stupid" for demanding the release of files related to dead paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump calls supporters 'weaklings' and 'stupid' amid Epstein row

image.altText: Albanese clasps his hands in front of a boom mic with the Great Wall behind him

props.synopsis: China doesn't want to kick up too much dust as it presents a friendlier face to the major US allies in this region: Australia, Japan and South Korea.

title.children: One thing stood out on Albanese's China trip — the lack of chaos

image.altText: Grace Tame

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame says the government is moving too slowly to protect children online, as advocates meet at parliament urging that AI tools used to create child abuse material be criminalised.

title.children: Grace Tame urges government to criminalise AI tools used for child abuse

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector has been home to two of the nation's most high-profile murderers, however, documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: Little discussion of high-profile murders at CASA and Airservices Australia

image.altText: File photo of Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell giving a speech, with Donald Trump standing behind him, on November 2, 2017.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he is not planning to fire Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, leading to a recovery on Wall Street. The local share market is poised to rise at the start of trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Trump 'not planning' to fire Fed chair Jerome Powell

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: More women on boards, but not in leadership roles
Would take 'large' jobs surprise to curb rate cut expectations: CBA
Trump denies plans to fire Powell, stocks recover

image.altText: A group of people walk through a sports stadium.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will today visit the central Chinese city of Chengdu as he finishes his six-day trip to the country. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese wraps up China visit in Chengdu

image.altText: Smoke risies in the distance between buildings

props.synopsis: At least one person has died after air strikes on the Syrian capital of Damascus.

title.children: Israel strikes Syria's military HQ and area near presidential palace

image.altText: A serious-looking man with a beard and glasses, facing the camera with arms crossed in front of a brick house.

props.synopsis: Sophisticated subscription services that utilise multiple languages and can mimic legitimate brands are being used by criminals to trick consumers into visiting fake websites.

title.children: Criminal software 'Darcula' tricking consumers with fake websites

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage fatigues looks down the sights of a rifle during a drill held near school buildings.

props.synopsis: Taiwan is wary of increasing pressure from Beijing and this year it has beefed up its defence drills and is training citizens of all ages to be ready for any forceful attempts to make it join the People's Republic of China.

title.children: Taiwan runs largest defence drills as pressure from Beijing mounts

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Outback murderer Bradley Murdoch's death could present a fresh opportunity to find the remains of his victim, British backpacker Peter Falconio, according to a leading forensic expert.

title.children: Killer's death presents 'opportunity' to find Falconio's remains

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white beard sits beside a woman in a brown dress with red dirt on the ground.

props.synopsis: The Kumanjayi Walker Inquest backs Aboriginal-led solutions and restoring Warlpiri self-determination, which his family says will "prevent deaths in custody".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker could lead NT communities taking back full control

image.altText: A man with an Australian flag bandana brandishes a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Southern Cross University provides research funding to a conspiracy theorist who has wrongly claimed fire ant bait causes ADHD, autism, and low fertility in humans.

title.children: Fire ant conspiracy theorist gets uni funding for field work

image.altText: A person in a hard hat works on a huge metal pipe system inside a concrete tunnel, with a bike to one side.

props.synopsis: Current models of physics dictate there should be as much antimatter in the universe as matter, but there isn't. Work at the world's largest particle collider has come a step closer to explaining why.

title.children: Atom smasher spots new clue to explain why the universe exists

image.altText: A close up of a woman with a white dress and pixie cut

props.synopsis: Watson, 35, was banned for driving at 38 miles per hour (61kph) in a 30-mile zone in south-east England.

title.children: Harry Potter actress Emma Watson banned from driving after speeding

image.altText: A protester runs out on the course during a Tour de France stage.

props.synopsis: Defending champion Tadej Pogačar is involved in a crash at the Tour de France moments before a protester disrupts the sprint finish where Norway's Jonas Abrahamsen claims his first stage victory.

title.children: Pogačar crashes before anti-Israel protester disrupts TDF stage finale

image.altText: Woman laughing behind the wheel of a large vehicle.

props.synopsis: Heather Ewart was a powerhouse political reporter when she was asked to create a show about regional Australia. A decade later, and with her final season going to air, Ewart admits that getting the idea off the ground was no easy feat.

title.children: Ten years telling tales from the bush: Heather Ewart signs off from Back Roads

image.altText: A group of young pelicans stand in the water of a lagoon

props.synopsis: After decades of environmental degradation, South Australia's internationally significant Coorong wetlands are now at risk of becoming a "wasteland" due to the state's toxic algal bloom, advocates fear.

title.children: Coorong ‘on the brink’ amid fears algal bloom could be final straw

image.altText: Photos of the roof of an old church.

props.synopsis: A law firm plans to launch a class action against the Christian Brothers over alleged "serious physical abuse" of students at Hobart's St Virgil's College in the 1970s and 80s.

title.children: Class action planned over alleged 'cruel' punishment at Catholic school

image.altText: An ankle monitor used by WA Police

props.synopsis: Months after issues emerged with the rollout of mandatory GPS tracking of domestic violence offenders, the government promises to fund 38 more staff.

title.children: Government accused of playing catch-up over extra GPS tracking funding

image.altText: Man wearing a black shirt that says 'Burgertory' on the collar, with his arms folded.

props.synopsis: Fast-food chain boss Hash Tayeh has quit as CEO of Burgertory, less than a month after being hit with a $1 million tax bill for debts allegedly run up by 12 companies.

title.children: Burgertory CEO quits amid 'targeted attacks' and $1 million tax bill

image.altText: A tall person walking alongside a smaller woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: The ACT Health pilot program, beginning in six months, hopes to reduce the number of Canberrans facing lengthy waits for an attention deficit hyperactivity disorder diagnosis and those having to travel interstate for quicker access to care.

title.children: 'Aren't enough': Some Canberra GPs will soon be allowed to diagnose ADHD

image.altText: Empty bed at Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital

props.synopsis: Elective surgeries have been paused for 48 hours while resources are diverted to emergency departments.

title.children: Elective surgeries paused at major Qld hospitals 'overwhelmed' by flu cases

image.altText: Paul Gallen declared winner by split decision following his main event boxing match against Sonny Bill Williams.

props.synopsis: Paul Gallen scores a split-points win over Sonny Bill Williams in their long-awaited heavyweight boxing bout in Sydney.

title.children: Gallen wins points verdict in hyped fight with SBW

image.altText: A bespectacled RAYE & Mark Ronson sit posing at an upright piano

props.synopsis: Hit-maker Mark Ronson has collaborated with everyone from Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars to the late, great Amy Winehouse. Now he's added another name to his CV: breakout talent Raye.

title.children: Has Mark Ronson found his next Amy Winehouse?

image.altText: A person pouring a cup of water into the hands of a monk.

props.synopsis: A Central Investigation Bureau deputy commissioner says the investigation began last month after an abbot of a famous temple in Bangkok abruptly left the monkhood.

title.children: Thai woman arrested for allegedly seducing and blackmailing Buddhist monks

image.altText: A person in black holds up a yellow fire hose and points it at a blaze

props.synopsis: Russia pounds four Ukrainian cities, injuring at least 15 people in an attack that mostly targeted energy infrastructure, officials say.

title.children: Russian bombardment targets Zelenskyy's hometown, injuring at least 15 people

image.altText: women and baby crying

props.synopsis: The aid distribution organisation, which is backed by the US and Israel, confirmed 20 Palestinians were killed at one of its sites.

title.children: 20 people killed at US-backed aid distribution site in Gaza

image.altText: Carolina raises her hand in the air while smiling and is surrounded by food on a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Ms Wilga is discharged from Fiona Stanley Hospital after spending five nights there recovering from her outback ordeal.

title.children: German backpacker Carolina Wilga leaves hospital in Perth

image.altText: A large lizard with it's mouth open to the camera.

props.synopsis: Ecologist Kristoffer Wild spent a year in the Australian outback fitting bearded dragons with hand-sewn jackets with GPS trackers to track every second of the lizards' lives.

title.children: Lizards wearing tiny backpacks live fast and die young

image.altText: Denieka Dewar and Kaylem Hardy with their two children in a bushy area

props.synopsis: Tasmania has the worst childcare access in Australia, with more than half the state considered a "childcare desert". A service at risk of closure says while election promises are encouraging, they don't go far enough.

title.children: Major parties take aim at Tasmania's childcare 'desert' to sway votes

image.altText: A surfer rides a wave in front of homes beneath a lighthouse, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A man was allegedly bashed in the head with a rock in front of horrified onlookers in the tourist town this week, which followed a vicious gang beating in a car park in June.

title.children: Byron Bay safe despite pair of brutal alleged assaults, police say

image.altText: A police officer walks beside a taller individual in a grey tracksuit along a street next to a police van.

props.synopsis: The victims said the four men entered the home yelling, 'Where is the money?' before violently stabbing a woman four times.

title.children: 17yo violent home invader told police he thought it was a camping trip

image.altText: Moesha Johnson on podium with fellow medallist at World Aquatics Championships.

props.synopsis: Moesha Johnson wins Australia's first 10-kilometre open water world title, as compatriot Kyle Lee opened the team medal tally with bronze in the men's race.

title.children: Johnson wins first Australian 10km world swim title

image.altText: A blue sculpture among pavers and trees.

props.synopsis: A controversial sculpture that sparked complaints about its cost and design arrives in Mount Gambier to a positive reception.

title.children: 'Blue blob' or 'beloved new landmark'? It's got this city talking
